Description: Fragment of cast amuletic pendant in copper alloy; very thin; two rings welded behind; corroded.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This type of amulet is associated to the protection of the moon god and is particularly popular in the Roman period (Petrie 1914, 23, pl. VI no. 85, especially very closed specimens 85 n in bronze, dated to the Late Roman period). Petrie, W.M.F. 1914, Amulets, London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OK.368) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
